intro: Ecbolium hyssopifolium, commonly known as the Mexican hyssop, is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. It is native to Mexico and parts of Central America, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are often aromatic and have been used in traditional herbal remedies. Ecbolium hyssopifolium is a hardy shrub that is well adapted to drought conditions.
